sensory_systems.name: Advanced Dough Rheology Sensor
sensory_systems.description: A multi-probe system utilizing shear stress, extensional viscosity, and elasticity measurements to dynamically characterize dough consistency in real-time. Incorporates miniature strain gauges and high-resolution force sensors. Measures hydration, gluten development, and protein network structure.

specifications.data_output: Real-time streaming data to control system

sensory_systems.name: Volumetric Moisture Sensor (VMS)
sensory_systems.description: A near-infrared (NIR) spectroscopy system for rapid and non-destructive determination of grain moisture content and hydration levels within the dough. Accounts for variations in flour composition and temperature.

sensory_systems.name: Olfactory Array (Electronic Nose - e-Nose)
sensory_systems.description: An array of micro-sensors (e.g., metal oxide sensors, conducting polymer sensors) to detect volatile organic compounds (VOCs) indicative of bread aroma development. Used for assessing crust color, fermentation stage, and final flavor profile.

sensory_systems.name: Visual Inspection System (AI-Powered)
sensory_systems.description: High-resolution color cameras coupled with deep learning algorithms for automated crust color assessment and defect detection (e.g., blisters, cracks).

specifications.deep_learning_model: Convolutional Neural Networks (CNNs) – >95% accuracy for defect detection

control_systems.name: Model Predictive Control (MPC)
control_systems.description: A control algorithm leveraging dough rheological data, temperature, and fermentation rate models to dynamically adjust mixing speed, proofing conditions, and baking parameters.

specifications.optimization_objective: Maximize bread quality metrics (volume, crumb structure, crust color)

control_systems.name: Adaptive Fuzzy Logic Controller
control_systems.description: A control system that adjusts baking parameters based on sensory feedback and learns from past production runs, improving consistency and robustness.

specifications.input_variables: Dough rheology, flour moisture, temperature, humidity

mechanical_systems.name: Robotic Dough Mixer
mechanical_systems.description: A six-axis robotic arm integrated with variable-speed mixers and precise ingredient dispensers. Optimized for rapid and consistent dough development.

mechanical_systems.name: Automated Proofing Chamber
mechanical_systems.description: A climate-controlled chamber with precise temperature and humidity control, utilizing ultrasonic sensors for real-time monitoring of dough volume and CO2 levels.

mechanical_systems.name: Automated Baking System
mechanical_systems.description: A conveyor-based baking system with robotic loading/unloading and precise temperature/time control.  Utilizes infrared emitters for consistent baking.

software_integration.name: Digital Twin Platform
software_integration.description: A real-time simulation of the entire breadmaking process, integrating data from all sensors and control systems. Used for process optimization and anomaly detection.

specifications.simulation_fidelity: High-fidelity, incorporating detailed dough rheology and heat transfer models.
specifications.data_integration_capacity: Handles data from all sensors and control systems.
specifications.analytics_engine: Machine learning algorithms for predictive maintenance and process optimization.

software_integration.name: AI-Powered Recipe Management System
software_integration.description: A system that manages bread recipes, adjusts parameters based on sensor data, and suggests new recipes based on consumer preferences.

specifications.flavor_profile_database: Comprehensive database of flavor compounds and their impact on bread flavor.
specifications.user_preference_learning: Utilizes machine learning to adapt recipes to individual preferences.
